news.title: Mid-Day Digest
news.text:
THE FOUNDATION

‚ÄúThey define a republic to be a government of laws, and not of men.‚Äù ‚ÄîJohn Adams (1775)

IN TODAY‚ÄôS DIGEST

Executive News Summary
Featured Analysis: This Weekend‚Äôs Other ICE Storm
More Analysis
Best of Right Opinion
Best of Videos

Today‚Äôs Meme

EXECUTIVE NEWS SUMMARY

The Editors

Good news: Crime is down: The murder rate across America hit a historic low last year, says a newly released report from the Council on Criminal Justice. The report, which analyzed crime stats from 40 cities, noted that 11 of 13 crime categories saw a decline. Nine categories saw decreases of 10% or greater, and homicides dropped 21%. White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt highlighted the lowest homicide rate since 1900, concluding, ‚ÄúThis is what happens when you have a President who fully mobilizes federal law enforcement to arrest violent criminals and the worst of the worst illegal aliens.‚Äù The city with the largest drop in homicides was Denver, which reported a 41% decline, followed by Washington, DC, and Omaha, both with 40% declines. Overall, violent crime dropped to its lowest level since 2019, and car theft dropped by 27%.
Warrantless ICE entrees? Whistleblower Aid, a nonprofit legal organization, circulated an ICE memo obtained from two unnamed government officials to Congress, and Democrat Sen. Richard Blumenthal has now released it to the public. The memo, signed by Acting ICE Director Todd Lyons, instructs ICE agents on methods to enter the homes of illegal immigrants using only a Form I-205 ‚Äúadministrative warrant.‚Äù The whistleblowers and Blumenthal decry this action, as administrative warrants have typically only been used to arrest illegal immigrants in public places. Form I-205 differs from a judicial warrant in that it is signed by an ICE officer and relies on a prior final removal order issued by a judge. Typical judicial warrants to forcibly enter a home require a neutral magistrate‚Äôs signature. Although in today‚Äôs political climate, neutral magistrates may be an extinct species.
House passes last four funding bills: On Thursday, the House passed its final funding bills for 2026, as three minibus bills were packaged and passed by a vote of 341-88. These bills provide funding for the War Department, HUD, HHS, Transportation, Labor, and Education. The bill funding DHS was also passed by a vote of 220-207, despite opposition raised by Democrat leaders, who sought to politicize the death of anti-ICE agitator Renee Good over their opposition to the Trump administration‚Äôs immigration enforcement. Speaker Mike Johnson praised the House‚Äôs progress and attributed it to ‚Äúreturning the appropriations process to a committee-led, member-driven approach, as it should be.‚Äù The funding bills now head to the Senate, where they are expected to be taken up prior to the January 30 deadline.
Trump sues JPMorgan for $5 billion: In the wake of the protest-turned-riot on January 6, 2021, a bevy of institutions took action to silence the 45th president. Shortly after he left office, Donald Trump and his organization were informed that JPMorgan Chase had made the ‚Äúfinal and unequivocal‚Äù decision to close his accounts, giving him just weeks to find an alternative. The lawsuit alleges that JPMC‚Äôs decision was because ‚Äúthe political tide at the moment favored doing so.‚Äù The bank argues that its commitment to following the letter and the spirit of the law left it no choice but to debank the former president against its own wishes. Somehow, the largest banking institution in America arguing that its hands were tied and that it had no alternative but to take unilateral action of a kind never seen before, without taking the issue to court, just doesn‚Äôt ring true.
Sayonara, WHO: The Trump administration officially withdrew the U.S. from the World Health Organization yesterday, ending its 78-year membership with the UN‚Äôs health agency. The White House pointed to the WHO‚Äôs mishandling of the COVID pandemic and subsequent ‚Äúfailure to adopt urgently needed reforms, and its inability to demonstrate independence from the inappropriate political influence‚Äù from the likes of China as the reason for this action. The fact of the matter is that, like much of the UN, the WHO has become little other than an organization that exists to push increasingly radical leftist ideology under the guise of ‚Äúhealthcare‚Äù and ‚Äúscience.‚Äù It‚Äôs a globalist front organization, and it‚Äôs about time America reclaimed a bit of sovereignty and left.
The TikTok deal: All those leftists who use TikTok can thank President Trump for saving it, but they won‚Äôt. After a year of extensions on the complete ban, a deal has been reached for a group of investors that includes the American tech giant Oracle, the California-based private equity fund Silver Lake, and the United Arab Emirates investment firm MGX, with ByteDance keeping a 19.9% stake in the U.S. operation. Trump‚Äôs fourth extension was going to end today, so the deal came in the nick of time. The New York Times cried foul because several of the investors have ties to Trump, but the real concern is whether China still controls the algorithms and data. The deal did not transfer the company‚Äôs algorithm to the new enterprise; rather, ByteDance is licensing it to the U.S. TikTok. Who controls the propaganda machine remains to be seen.
No more funding for research via fetal tissue: Donald Trump, the self-described ‚Äúmost pro-life president ever,‚Äù sometimes needs reminding of that fact, but not this time. The National Institutes of Health on Thursday ended federal funding for any research that uses tissue from aborted babies. This win prevents the sale of aborted babies to labs for research into areas like stem cells, but NIH Director Jay Bhattacharya stressed that parents who suffer miscarriages can still donate the baby‚Äôs body to science. Abortion is the moral issue of our time, and widespread adoption of the abortion pill has led to an explosion of problems, but decisions like this from the NIH that get between abortionists and a paycheck are a step in the right direction.
Nick Shirley eyes California: The upstart journalist who exposed the ‚ÄúQuality Learing Center‚Äù in Minnesota is turning his attention to California. His path is not easy. Nick Shirley‚Äôs home has been doxed, and his family has received calls from the public, forcing him to hire 24-hour security. Undeterred, Shirley has said he will pursue fraud cases in California to discover the truth. He specifically mentioned California‚Äôs high-speed rail project, which has been ongoing for decades and has produced no visible results so far. Earlier this year, First Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Central District of California Bill Essayli launched an investigation into the $24 billion the state had spent over the last five years to combat homelessness, an amount ‚Äúno one can account for.‚Äù Blue states, it seems, provide fraud investigators like Shirley fertile ground with which to work.
TPUSA sends cease-and-desist to Candace: She has been asking for it for months, and it finally happened: podcaster Candace Owens received a cease-and-desist letter from Turning Point USA. The final warning implores Owens to stop her ongoing smear campaign since the assassination of TPUSA founder Charlie Kirk, wherein she has been spinning increasingly outlandish and false conspiracies blaming members of TPUSA and even Charlie‚Äôs wife, Erika, for ‚Äúsomehow‚Äù being involved in his murder. An increasingly unhinged Owens responded to the letter by insisting that it was more ‚Äúevidence‚Äù proving her wild conspiracy claims and then claimed, ‚ÄúGet your lawyer to send a cease-and-desist to the sun, and you will have better luck getting it to stop than getting me to look away from what happened to Charlie. That‚Äôs how I feel, uhkay?‚Äù Looks like Owens will soon be facing a lawsuit.

Trump revokes Canada‚Äôs spot on ‚ÄúBoard of Peace‚Äù following Davos remarks (Fox News)
Judge bars FBI from reviewing seized Washington Post reporter‚Äôs electronics (Washington Examiner)
Trump aims to topple Cuba‚Äôs communist regime by the end of the year: report (NY Post)
The Chinese spy machine infiltrating Taiwan‚Äôs military (WSJ)
Satire: Minnesota arrests churchgoers for interrupting protest (Babylon Bee)

The Executive News Summary is compiled daily by Jordan Candler, Thomas Gallatin, Sterling Henry, and Sophie Starkova. For the archive, click here.

Comment | Share

FEATURED ANALYSIS

This Weekend‚Äôs Other ICE Storm

Nate Jackson

Much of the nation is deeply concerned about winter weather this weekend, but ICE is dominating the news coverage. Why? Because Leftmedia hysteria over the actions and tactics of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement helps Democrats and hurts the Bad Orange Man.

There are so many news ICEicles out there today, but I want to use those to better view the big picture, which is the Left‚Äôs tireless work to discredit everything President Donald Trump and his administration do. They don‚Äôt want to clean up ICE enforcement. They want to end ICE enforcement. Joe Biden and Kamala Harris opened the border, creating a humanitarian crisis, and now leftists say the real problem is cleaning up that mess.

I‚Äôll start with pollaganda ‚Äî the use of polls to steer rather than reflect public opinion. In the wake of what I think was the justifiable shooting death of Renee Good, numerous media outlets are blaring headlines to say something along the lines of ‚ÄúAmericans think ICE is going too far.‚Äù Yes, I‚Äôm sorry Good is dead. But the Leftmedia coverage of it has not been fair or honest, and emotion, not evidence, is dictating much of the public‚Äôs response.

That said, our Mark Alexander rightly warned in early December that ICE already had an optics problem ‚Äî and that was before Good‚Äôs death or a whistleblower‚Äôs claim that an ICE policy allows agents to enter the home of a suspected illegal alien without a warrant. If true, that‚Äôs a significant problem, though I‚Äôm reserving judgment because of the left-wing operation to discredit ICE.

Regardless of the truth or the Left‚Äôs lawless motivations, leftist agitators are successfully turning the public against ICE.

The latest example came yesterday. ‚ÄúICE just detained a 5-year-old child,‚Äù Representative Ilhan Omar (D-Somalia) railed on X. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt tell us this is about ‚Äòthe worst of the worst.‚Äô That‚Äôs a lie. Absolutely vile.‚Äù

What a missed opportunity for Omar to plug one of those Somali daycares her Minneapolis constituents run. I hear there are lots of openings.

Sarcasm aside, the Department of Homeland Security says Omar is lying: ‚ÄúAs agents approached ‚Ä¶ Adrian Alexander Conejo Arias, [he] fled on foot ‚Äî abandoning his child. For the child‚Äôs safety, one of our ICE officers remained with the child while the other officers apprehended Conejo Arias.‚Äù

That‚Äôs why both are in ICE custody, now in Texas. Leftists scream if children are separated from their parents, and they scream if a child is detained with his father. That‚Äôs because they‚Äôre screaming about enforcing immigration law, not about children. They certainly don‚Äôt raise much of a complaint about the human traffickers who abuse migrant children; only ICE receives their ire ‚Äî for apprehending child sex offenders!

‚ÄúParents are asked if they want to be removed with their children,‚Äù DHS added, ‚Äúor ICE will place the children with a safe person the parent designates. This is consistent with past administrations‚Äô immigration enforcement.‚Äù Furthermore, ‚ÄúParents can take control of their departure and receive a free flight and $2,600 with the CBP Home app.‚Äù

Officials at the boy‚Äôs school claim that he was used ‚Äúas bait‚Äù to lure his father out of his house. The Leftmedia bewails the ‚Äúabhorrent‚Äù viral photo of the boy, though it looks totally innocuous to me.

Vice President JD Vance traveled to Minneapolis yesterday to address the broader situation and ‚Äúbring down the temperature.‚Äù How did USA Today headline it? ‚ÄúVice President Vance defends ICE detainment of 5-year-old in Minnesota.‚Äù

That was only one small part of Vance‚Äôs comments and purposes, but he did note, ‚ÄúIf the argument is that you can‚Äôt arrest people who have violated the law because they have children, then every single parent is going to be completely given immunity from ever being the subject of law enforcement.‚Äù

That‚Äôs a fair point, but Conejo Arias‚Äôs attorney says, ‚ÄúThese are not illegal aliens. They came properly and are pursuing a legal pathway.‚Äù That will need to be sorted out.

Vance also knew where to point a finger, saying, ‚ÄúFrankly, a lot of the media is lying about the job that [ICE agents] do every single day.‚Äù

As for the overall situation in Minnesota, Vance‚Äôs message was simple. Before he arrived, he said, ‚ÄúIf you want to turn down the chaos in Minneapolis, stop fighting immigration enforcement and accept that we have to have a border in this country. It‚Äôs not that hard.‚Äù While there, he added, ‚ÄúThe directive that I got from the president of the United States is ‚ÄòMeet these guys halfway.‚Äô Work with them so that we can make these immigration enforcement operations successful without endangering our ICE officers, and so that we could turn down the chaos a little bit, at least. I think a lot, actually.‚Äù

Democrat Governor Tim Walz responded that he was ‚Äúglad the Vice President agrees the temperature needs to be turned down, but actions speak louder than words.‚Äù His solution? ‚ÄúTake the show of force off the streets.‚Äù

Why is there a show of force? Because Minnesota is a sanctuary state where state and local officials don‚Äôt cooperate with federal officers. Why were Walz, state Attorney General Keith Ellison, and Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey served with Justice Department subpoenas on Tuesday? For alleged conspiracy to obstruct federal law enforcement.

Meanwhile, some anti-ICE activists who stormed that church service on Sunday found out that doing so is a crime.

‚ÄúWe have arrested Nekima Levy Armstrong, who allegedly played a key role in organizing the coordinated attack on Cities Church in St. Paul, Minnesota,‚Äù announced Attorney General Pam Bondi. Later, she added, ‚ÄúA second arrest has been made at my direction. Chauntyll Louisa Allen has been taken into custody.‚Äù

Given that the anti-ICE agitators filmed themselves violating the FACE Act, it‚Äôs hard to argue with the arrests. Armstrong tried, however, telling CNN, ‚ÄúWe did not rush into that church. We actually went and sat down and participated in the service.‚Äù Is that what you call it?

Former CNN personality Don Lemon, who entered the church with the protesters and live-streamed their intimidating service interruption ‚Äî definitely only for the sake of journalism! (wink, wink) ‚Äî has not been arrested. Never mind, I guess, that Lemon is on video announcing his disruptive intent, noting that Armstrong began her agitating work after George Floyd‚Äôs death.

Lemon‚Äôs lawyer, Abbe Lowell of Hunter Biden infamy, says the DOJ is engaged in a ‚Äústunning and troubling effort to silence and punish a journalist.‚Äù A magistrate judge rejected charges against Lemon. That judge, by the way, is connected to the anti-ICE Democrat machine, which seems like a conflict of interest. According to Fox News‚Äôs Bill Melugin, ‚ÄúMultiple sources tell me & colleague [David Spunt] that the federal magistrate in Minnesota who refused to sign off on an arrest warrant for Don Lemon is Douglas L. Micko and that his wife works as an Assistant Attorney General in Minnesota AG Keith Ellison‚Äôs office.‚Äù

Whew, that‚Äôs a lot of news, but again, there‚Äôs a big picture.

Democrats, their Leftmedia propagandists, and their horde of left-wing agitators have a singular strategy: Discredit ICE and Trump by creating and filming confrontations with federal agents. Never mind that a lot of migrant criminals are in our nation illegally. Never mind that many of those criminals have victimized American citizens. Never mind the Rule of Law. The Left is waging a propaganda war against law enforcement.

ICE doesn‚Äôt always do everything perfectly, and there are definitely risks of overstepping. But those factors are exponentially increased when agitators provoke conflict. The ugly part is that‚Äôs exactly their strategy, even if it gets people killed.

Follow Nate Jackson on X.

Shot/Chaser

‚ÄúICE just detained a 5-year-old child. Don‚Äôt tell us this is about ‚Äòthe worst of the worst.‚Äô That‚Äôs a lie. Absolutely vile.‚Äù ‚ÄîRep. Ilhan Omar (D-MN)

The BIG Lie

‚ÄúWe did not rush into that church. We actually went and sat down and participated in the service.‚Äù ‚ÄîNekima Levy Armstrong, organizer of the protest meant to spread terror at Cities Church in St. Paul, Minnesota, on Sunday

Just Deserts

‚ÄúWe have arrested Nekima Levy Armstrong, who allegedly played a key role in organizing the coordinated attack on Cities Church in St. Paul, Minnesota.‚Äù ‚ÄîAttorney General Pam Bondi

Re: The Left

‚ÄúIn honor of Martin Luther King Jr. Day this week, every liberal made the totally original point that anti-ICE protesters in Minneapolis are walking in King‚Äôs footsteps! King protested ‚Äî and they‚Äôre protesting. See? Same thing.‚Äù ‚ÄîAnn Coulter

‚ÄúThe Democratic Party has repeatedly searched for what might come next: a successor to the civil rights movement that once defined its moral authority. Over the decades, a series of causes have been framed in those terms, often with strained comparisons to the racial discrimination of the mid-20th century. ‚Ä¶ Now, Democrats appear to have settled on a new cause: illegal immigration.‚Äù ‚ÄîBen Shapiro

This is the precious inheritance that America and Europe have in common. We share it. ‚Ä¶ We have to keep it strong. ‚Ä¶ We have to defend that culture and rediscover the spirit that lifted the West from the depths of the Dark Ages to the pinnacle of human achievement.‚Äù ‚ÄîDonald Trump

‚ÄúSo total revenue has hit new highs, individual income taxes are at record levels (though down slightly under Trump) but the debt keeps rising. Raise your hand if you know why. Yes, it‚Äôs because spending keeps increasing.‚Äù ‚ÄîCal Thomas

news.title: Did ICE Detain a 5-Year-Old Child? What We Know About the Case
news.text:
Liam Conejo Ramos was identified as the 5-year-old boy being taken by ICE (Immigration and Customs Enforcement) agents from a viral photo that has sparked widespread debate across the U.S. The child was seen with an ICE officer in Minneota after coming home from preschool on January 20, 2026, while his father, Adrian Alexander Conejo Arias, was being detained.

Multiple celebrities reacted to the shocking incident, including Reese Witherspoon, her daughter, Ava Phillippe, Hailey Bieber and Gigi Hadid.

Here is what we know about Conejo Ramos‚Äô ICE detainment.

Liam Ramos is just a baby. He should be at home with his family, not used as bait by ICE and held in a Texas detention center.
I am outraged, and you should be too. pic.twitter.com/djr2z1AG0N
‚Äî Kamala Harris (@KamalaHarris) January 22, 2026

Did ICE Really Detain a 5-Year-Old Child?

Yes, the child was detained alongside his father, Adrian Alexander Conejo Arias, according to multiple outlets such as FOX9, People, ABC News and more.

The Department of Homeland Security maintained that the child was not targeted, though, and that he was ‚Äúabandoned‚Äù by his father.

‚ÄúICE did NOT target a child. The child was ABANDONED,‚Äù the department tweeted in a statement. ‚ÄúOn January 20, ICE conducted a targeted operation to arrest Adrian Alexander Conejo Arias, an illegal alien from Ecuador who was RELEASED into the U.S. by the [Joe] Biden administration. As agents approached the driver, Adrian Alexander Conejo Arias, fled on foot ‚Äî abandoning his child.‚Äù

ICE did NOT target a child. The child was ABANDONED.
On January 20, ICE conducted a targeted operation to arrest Adrian Alexander Conejo Arias an illegal alien from Ecuador who was RELEASED into the U.S. by the Biden administration. 
As agents approached the driver Adrian‚Ä¶ https://t.co/UmxxV34omm
‚Äî Homeland Security (@DHSgov) January 22, 2026

The department‚Äôs statement continued, ‚ÄúFor the child‚Äôs safety, one of our ICE officers remained with the child while the other officers apprehended Conejo Arias. Parents are asked if they want to be removed with their children, or ICE will place the children with a safe person the parent designates. This is consistent with past administration‚Äôs immigration enforcement [sic]. Parents can take control of their departure and receive a free flight and $2,600 with the CBP Home app. By using the CBP Home app, illegal aliens reserve the chance to come back the right legal way.‚Äù

According to Columbia Heights Public Schools Superintendent Zena Stenvik, Conejo Ramos‚Äô family ‚Äúis following U.S. legal parameters and has an active asylum case with no order of deportation.‚Äù

‚ÄúI have viewed the legal paperwork with my own eyes,‚Äù Stenvik noted, according to FOX9. ‚ÄúWhy detain a 5-year-old? You cannot tell me that this child is going to be classified as a violent criminal.‚Äù

Where Is Liam Conejo Ramos Now? Update After ICE Detainment

At the time of publication, Conejo Ramos is with his father at the Dilley Immigration Processing Center in Texas, family attorney Marc Prokosch said, per ABC News.
news.summary: A heartbreaking photo of a young boy standing with an ICE officer has caused widespread outrage amid Donald Trump's immigration crackdown.

news.title: Trump makes bold claims during late-night Truth Social posting spree
news.text:
Donald Trump posted over 70 times on Truth Social between midnight and 1 a.m. ET, shortly after returning to Washington, D.C. from the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland. 

His posts included attacks on political opponents such as Ilhan Omar, Joe Biden, Gavin Newsom, and Kamala Harris, alongside promoting a documentary about his wife, Melania. 

Trump also reiterated false claims about the 2020 election and asserted he was responsible for ‚Äúsaving TikTok‚Äù after a deal was reached for the platform to operate in the US. 

After a brief break, he resumed posting at 7 a.m. ET, sharing clips from pro-Trump news channels and an article from The Hill. 

House Speaker Mike Johnson defended Trump's energy levels, stating he sleeps around three hours a night, following questions about Trump's speech and a visible bruise on his hand during his Davos appearance.
news.author: Rhian Lubin

news.title: Trump admin orders funding probe of states that didn't vote for him: 'Blatantly illegal'
news.text:
The Trump White House has reportedly ordered federal agencies to conduct a sweeping review of funding to more than a dozen states carried by former Vice President Kamala Harris in the 2024 election, a move that lawmakers from the targeted states condemned as unlawful political retaliation.

The review, first reported by RealClearPolitics, was outlined in a data request that the White House Office of Management and Budget (OMB) sent out on Tuesday. Every federal department and agency was included in the request except for the Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs.

California, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Illinois, Massachusetts, Minnesota, New Jersey, New York, Oregon, Rhode Island, Vermont, Washington state, and Washington, DC are the jurisdictions targeted by the OMB.

The OMB memo, according to the Washington Post, ‚Äúrequests agencies provide detailed information on all funds to those states, including money routed for state and local governments, nonprofit organizations, and higher education institutions.‚Äù OMB claims it is trying to root out fraud.

‚ÄúThis is authoritarianism, plain and simple,‚Äù said Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT), whose state is the only one on the list with a Republican governor.

‚ÄúThe Trump administration is targeting states that didn‚Äôt vote for him‚Äîincluding my home state of Vermont,‚Äù Sanders added. ‚ÄúUsing federal power to punish political opponents is anti-democratic and blatantly illegal.‚Äù

Sen. Jeff Merkley (D-OR) similarly condemned the funding investigation as ‚Äúmore political retribution from Trump, the authoritarian strongman, and his crony Russ Vought,‚Äù the head of OMB.

‚ÄúThis is a blatant and dangerous abuse of power,‚Äù Merkley wrote on social media. ‚ÄúTrump does not care how many people he hurts to score cheap political points.‚Äù

The OMB data request is just the latest instance of the Trump administration specifically targeting federal funds to Democratic-led states.

The White House budget office previously tried to cut off clean energy funds to Democratic-run states before being blocked in court. Earlier this month, the Trump administration froze $10 billion in childcare and social services funding for low-income families in five Democratic-led states, claiming fraud.

Sharon Parrott, president of the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities, said the administration‚Äôs new funding investigation ‚Äúfollows a clear pattern‚Äù and marks ‚Äúa harmful and shameful escalation of the administration‚Äôs corrupt politicization of basic governance.‚Äù

‚ÄúWithholding federal funding can have grave consequences,‚Äù said Parrott. ‚ÄúJust take the five-state freeze on childcare. In just those states, those funds are used to provide care to nearly 340,000 children. Without funding, childcare providers close, kids don‚Äôt get care, and parents can‚Äôt go to work.‚Äù
news.summary:
The Trump White House has reportedly ordered federal agencies to conduct a sweeping review of funding to more than a dozen states carried by former Vice President Kamala Harris in the 2024 election, a move that lawmakers from the targeted states condemned as unlawful political retaliation.

The review, first reported by RealClearPolitics, was outlined in a data request that the White House Office of Management and Budget (OMB) sent out on Tuesday. Every federal department and agency was included in the request except for the Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs.

California, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Illinois, Massachusetts, Minnesota, New Jersey, New York, Oregon, Rhode Island, Vermont, Washington state, and Washington, DC are the jurisdictions targeted by the OMB.

news.title: Rich Americans Fleeing Trump Fuel Luxury Property Spike Abroad
news.text:
An exodus of wealthy Americans during the second Trump administration has driven a boom in luxury property sales in the City of Light. 

Sales in Paris and areas surrounding the French capital leapt by a whopping 22% in 2025, marking the biggest spike in two decades and putting an end to a two-year slump, Bloomberg reports.

The Bloomberg report isn‚Äôt the only evidence that wealthy Americans are looking to leave the U.S. for other countries. A survey of 1,000 U.S. millionaires by Arton Capital, a company that specializes in helping wealthy people get second citizenship, found that roughly a third are more likely to leave the country now than before Trump‚Äôs re-election. 

Barron‚Äôs reports poll respondents cited concerns about foreign policy‚Äîespecially MAGA‚Äôs invasion of Venezuela, threatened annexation of Greenland, and prospective trade war with Europe‚Äîas well as mounting economic uncertainty and political violence.

The survey also revealed that of those who said they are motivated to leave the U.S., 52 percent say they voted for Democrat Kamala Harris in the 2024 presidential election; only 15 percent of Trump voters want to leave the country. 

Among those who have already left the U.S. to avoid the second reign of President Donald Trump are former daytime TV host Ellen DeGeneres and her wife, actress Portia de Rossi. The couple relocated to the Cotswolds region of England following the 2024 election, citing Trump‚Äôs victory as the reason for their departure. 

Comedian Rosie O‚ÄôDonnell has similarly moved to Ireland with her child, which she‚Äôs chalked up to fears for her personal safety amid a series of escalations in her long-running personal spat with the MAGA president.

Director James Cameron was granted New Zealand citizenship, where he has been living for several years in what he describes as a search for ‚Äúsanity‚Äù away from the U.S. political context.

Actor George Clooney, another longtime Trump critic, and his wife, Amal, have similarly now become French citizens and intend to shift their primary residence to France.
news.summary:
Tasos Katopodis / Getty ImagesAn exodus of wealthy Americans during the second Trump administration has driven a boom in luxury property sales in the City of Light. 

Sales in Paris and areas surrounding the French capital leapt by a whopping 22% in 2025, marking the biggest spike in two decades and putting an end to a two-year slump, Bloomberg reports.

Americans were behind the majority of those purchases, ‚Äúprobably motivated by the political context in the United States, which they find less favorable in the Trump era,‚Äù the outlet adds, citing property company Barnes.

Read more at The Daily Beast.
news.author: Will Neal

news.title: Emmy Griffin: The Fight for the Preborn Is at a Pivotal Point
news.text:
The March for Life is happening today on the streets of Washington, DC. Even though Roe v. Wade has been overturned, this annual march still represents the seminal battle for the complete eradication of abortion in every state. It also raises awareness about other life-related issues like IVF and assisted suicide.

Vice President JD Vance is headlining today‚Äôs event, which is wonderful. He is more genuinely pro-life than President Donald Trump, with the added bonus that he and Second Lady Usha Vance are expecting their fourth child in July.

However, one could reasonably argue that this year‚Äôs March for Life is especially important.

In the lead-up to his victory in November 2024 and throughout his second term, Donald Trump has been shaky on pro-life issues. His campaign advisers evidently convinced him that the Dobbs v. Jackson ruling that overturned Roe v. Wade and sent the issue back to the states could hurt him in the election. It did not.

As the editors of National Review point out, ‚ÄúTrump‚Äôs decisive election victory, after Kamala Harris bet heavily on the abortion issue, showed that it was not the third rail that some pundits predicted after Dobbs.‚Äù

However, Trump has continued to act like this is a losing issue for the Republicans. He recently asked us to be flexible on the Hyde Amendment in attempting to solve the expanded ObamaCare subsidy tug of war. The Hyde Amendment doesn‚Äôt ban abortion, but it does stop federal dollars from funding it except in the cases of rape or incest.

President Trump is also very supportive of in vitro fertilization (IVF), which is a can of ethical worms in and of itself.

Finally, his administration has been slow to walk back the extremism of the Joe Biden era. Under President Biden, the abortion pill was approved to be sent to women who haven‚Äôt even visited a doctor. Some have died as a result. The Trump administration has yet to rein that in. The Food and Drug Administration promised to look into the harmful side effects of the abortion pill to mothers, but those findings have yet to be released.

To be fair, there have been plenty of pro-life wins from this administration. The One Big Beautiful Bill Act took away Medicaid funds from Planned Parenthood for one year. While this is hardly much, it‚Äôs still a win.

President Trump also pardoned those who were imprisoned by Biden‚Äôs excessive interpretation of the Freedom of Access to Clinic Entrances (FACE) Act.

And this week, the administration announced that the National Institutes of Health (NIH) is no longer using aborted baby parts for its scientific experiments. According to The Daily Wire, ‚ÄúThat policy will apply to all NIH grants, cooperative agreements, transaction awards, research and development contracts, and the NIH Intramural Research Program.‚Äù This new policy is a significant win for the pro-life cause.

Politically, the pro-life movement is at a crossroads. This was made clear by The Lamp managing editor Nic Rowan, who wrote in The Wall Street Journal:

The president‚Äôs support for pro-life positions is provisional. If he believes he needs pro-life votes to win an election, he modifies his views to approximate those of the movement. If he believes he can get by without opposing abortion, he mutes his support. Pro-lifers have to show he needs them to win.

They convinced him in 2016. The president repaid them with three originalist Supreme Court justices. These justices were all in the majority of the Dobbs decision, which in 2022 overturned the high court‚Äôs decision in Roe v. Wade and returned the regulation of abortion to ‚Äúthe people and their elected representatives.‚Äù

In other words, we need to convince him again. The absolute backwardness of having to convince someone that a preborn baby‚Äôs life has immeasurable value and deserves wholesale dignity is a commentary on the perverseness of our culture.

We pray for the marchers and their message. May it reach a receptive president‚Äôs ears.

news.title: Maine ICE raids followed Trump clash with Democratic governor. That‚Äôs happened elsewhere too.
news.text:
Governor Janet Mills was among the officials Thursday who strongly criticized the ICE operations in her state. 

‚ÄúIn America, we don‚Äôt believe in secret arrests or secret police,‚Äù Mills said during a news briefing as ICE agents fanned out across Portland.

The deployment came months after Mills had publicly sparred with Trump over the issue of transgender athletes in women‚Äôs sports in Maine. 

At a White House meeting in February, Trump told a room of bipartisan governors about his executive order banning ‚Äúmen from playing in women‚Äôs sports,‚Äù telling Democratic governors to continue fighting him on the legislation because ‚Äúyou‚Äôll never win another race.‚Äù

Trump then asked if the ‚ÄúGovernor of Maine‚Äù was in attendance and instructed the state to comply with the law, saying to Mills: ‚ÄúYou better do it, because you‚Äôre not going to get any federal funding at all if you don‚Äôt.‚Äù 

Mills doubled down on the state‚Äôs position by saying Maine would ‚Äúfollow the law.‚Äù 

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll see you in court,‚Äù she added.

‚ÄúGood, I‚Äôll see you in court. I look forward to that ‚Äî that should be a real easy one,‚Äù Trump said. ‚ÄúEnjoy your life after governor because I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôll be in elected politics.‚Äù

Mills is currently seeking her party‚Äôs nomination for the US Senate. 

The recent ICE deployments in Minnesota have become a flashpoint after an agent fatally shot Renee Good, a 37-year-old mother of three, in Minneapolis on Jan. 7. 

Days before Good‚Äôs killing, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz, former Vice President Kamala Harris‚Äôs running mate in 2024, had announced he wouldn‚Äôt seek reelection in Minnesota, citing Trump‚Äôs relentless focus on a fraud investigation into child care programs in the state. 

That probe came as a far-right influencer claimed to have uncovered fraud at day care centers operated by Somali residents in Minneapolis. 

‚ÄúDonald Trump and his allies ‚Äî in Washington, in St. Paul, and online ‚Äî want to make our state a colder, meaner place,‚Äù Walz said when he announced he would not seek reelection. ‚ÄúThey want to poison our people against each other by attacking our neighbors. And, ultimately, they want to take away much of what makes Minnesota the best place in America to raise a family.‚Äù

Good was killed two days later as she tried to drive away from a group of ICE agents. 

Trump deployed the National Guard to Los Angeles in June to quell demonstrations against his immigration crackdown. 

Trump said federalizing the troops was necessary to ‚Äúaddress the lawlessness‚Äù in California, while Governor Gavin Newsom, a likely Democratic presidential candidate in 2028, said the move was ‚Äúpurposely inflammatory‚Äù and would ‚Äúonly escalate tensions.‚Äù

The day after Trump was elected in November 2024, Newsom called on state lawmakers to convene a special session to safeguard the state‚Äôs progressive policies.

‚ÄúThe freedoms we hold dear in California are under attack ‚Äî and we won‚Äôt sit idle,‚Äù Newsom said at the time. He went on to launch a redistricting push in California to counter similar efforts in Texas. 

Newsom has also taken a page out of Trump‚Äôs social media playbook, often mocking the president online with all-caps posts that mirror Trump‚Äôs tone. 

Last month, a judge ordered Trump to end the National Guard deployment in Los Angeles. 

Demonstrators in the Chicago area took to the streets in the fall to protest the ICE crackdown there, prompting the Trump administration to seek a guard deployment to that city as well.

The administration had initially sought an order to allow the deployment of troops from Illinois and Texas, but the Texas contingent of about 200 guardsmen was later sent home from Chicago.

In December, the Supreme Court delivered a rare rebuke to the president, refusing to allow the guard to deploy to Chicago. 

‚ÄúAt this preliminary stage, the Government has failed to identify a source of authority that would allow the military to execute the laws in Illinois,‚Äù the high court majority wrote. Three conservative justices dissented.

Throughout the controversy, Illinois Governor JB Pritzker has strongly criticized Trump, even urging constituents to hold mass protests.

‚ÄúNever before in my life have I called for mass protests, for mobilization, for disruption. But I am now,‚Äù Pritzker said in April during a speech to Democrats in New Hampshire. 

‚ÄúThese Republicans cannot know a moment of peace,‚Äù Pritzker continued. ‚ÄúThey must understand that we will fight their cruelty with every megaphone and microphone that we have. We must castigate them on the soapbox ‚Ä¶ and then punish them at the ballot box.‚Äù 

Material from the Associated Press and from previous Globe coverage was used in this report. 

Travis Andersen can be reached at travis.andersen@globe.com.
news.author: Travis Andersen Globe

news.title: Nate Jackson: This Weekend's Other ICE Storm
news.text:
Much of the nation is deeply concerned about winter weather this weekend, but ICE is dominating the news coverage. Why? Because Leftmedia hysteria over the actions and tactics of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement helps Democrats and hurts the Bad Orange Man.

There are so many news ICEicles out there today, but I want to use those to better view the big picture, which is the Left‚Äôs tireless work to discredit everything President Donald Trump and his administration do. They don‚Äôt want to clean up ICE enforcement. They want to end ICE enforcement. Joe Biden and Kamala Harris opened the border, creating a humanitarian crisis, and now leftists say the real problem is cleaning up that mess.

I‚Äôll start with pollaganda ‚Äî the use of polls to steer rather than reflect public opinion. In the wake of what I think was the justifiable shooting death of Renee Good, numerous media outlets are blaring headlines to say something along the lines of ‚ÄúAmericans think ICE is going too far.‚Äù Yes, I‚Äôm sorry Good is dead. But the Leftmedia coverage of it has not been fair or honest, and emotion, not evidence, is dictating much of the public‚Äôs response.

That said, our Mark Alexander rightly warned in early December that ICE already had an optics problem ‚Äî and that was before Good‚Äôs death or a whistleblower‚Äôs claim that an ICE policy allows agents to enter the home of a suspected illegal alien without a warrant. If true, that‚Äôs a significant problem, though I‚Äôm reserving judgment because of the left-wing operation to discredit ICE.

Regardless of the truth or the Left‚Äôs lawless motivations, leftist agitators are successfully turning the public against ICE.

The latest example came yesterday. ‚ÄúICE just detained a 5-year-old child,‚Äù Representative Ilhan Omar (D-Somalia) railed on X. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt tell us this is about ‚Äòthe worst of the worst.‚Äô That‚Äôs a lie. Absolutely vile.‚Äù

What a missed opportunity for Omar to plug one of those Somali daycares her Minneapolis constituents run. I hear there are lots of openings.

Sarcasm aside, the Department of Homeland Security says Omar is lying: ‚ÄúAs agents approached ‚Ä¶ Adrian Alexander Conejo Arias, [he] fled on foot ‚Äî abandoning his child. For the child‚Äôs safety, one of our ICE officers remained with the child while the other officers apprehended Conejo Arias.‚Äù

That‚Äôs why both are in ICE custody, now in Texas. Leftists scream if children are separated from their parents, and they scream if a child is detained with his father. That‚Äôs because they‚Äôre screaming about enforcing immigration law, not about children. They certainly don‚Äôt raise much of a complaint about the human traffickers who abuse migrant children; only ICE receives their ire ‚Äî for apprehending child sex offenders!

‚ÄúParents are asked if they want to be removed with their children,‚Äù DHS added, ‚Äúor ICE will place the children with a safe person the parent designates. This is consistent with past administrations‚Äô immigration enforcement.‚Äù Furthermore, ‚ÄúParents can take control of their departure and receive a free flight and $2,600 with the CBP Home app.‚Äù

Officials at the boy‚Äôs school claim that he was used ‚Äúas bait‚Äù to lure his father out of his house. The Leftmedia bewails the ‚Äúabhorrent‚Äù viral photo of the boy, though it looks totally innocuous to me.

Vice President JD Vance traveled to Minneapolis yesterday to address the broader situation and ‚Äúbring down the temperature.‚Äù How did USA Today headline it? ‚ÄúVice President Vance defends ICE detainment of 5-year-old in Minnesota.‚Äù

That was only one small part of Vance‚Äôs comments and purposes, but he did note, ‚ÄúIf the argument is that you can‚Äôt arrest people who have violated the law because they have children, then every single parent is going to be completely given immunity from ever being the subject of law enforcement.‚Äù

That‚Äôs a fair point, but Conejo Arias‚Äôs attorney says, ‚ÄúThese are not illegal aliens. They came properly and are pursuing a legal pathway.‚Äù That will need to be sorted out.

Vance also knew where to point a finger, saying, ‚ÄúFrankly, a lot of the media is lying about the job that [ICE agents] do every single day.‚Äù

As for the overall situation in Minnesota, Vance‚Äôs message was simple. Before he arrived, he said, ‚ÄúIf you want to turn down the chaos in Minneapolis, stop fighting immigration enforcement and accept that we have to have a border in this country. It‚Äôs not that hard.‚Äù While there, he added, ‚ÄúThe directive that I got from the president of the United States is ‚ÄòMeet these guys halfway.‚Äô Work with them so that we can make these immigration enforcement operations successful without endangering our ICE officers, and so that we could turn down the chaos a little bit, at least. I think a lot, actually.‚Äù

Democrat Governor Tim Walz responded that he was ‚Äúglad the Vice President agrees the temperature needs to be turned down, but actions speak louder than words.‚Äù His solution? ‚ÄúTake the show of force off the streets.‚Äù

Why is there a show of force? Because Minnesota is a sanctuary state where state and local officials don‚Äôt cooperate with federal officers. Why were Walz, state Attorney General Keith Ellison, and Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey served with Justice Department subpoenas on Tuesday? For alleged conspiracy to obstruct federal law enforcement.

Meanwhile, some anti-ICE activists who stormed that church service on Sunday found out that doing so is a crime.

‚ÄúWe have arrested Nekima Levy Armstrong, who allegedly played a key role in organizing the coordinated attack on Cities Church in St. Paul, Minnesota,‚Äù announced Attorney General Pam Bondi. Later, she added, ‚ÄúA second arrest has been made at my direction. Chauntyll Louisa Allen has been taken into custody.‚Äù

Given that the anti-ICE agitators filmed themselves violating the FACE Act, it‚Äôs hard to argue with the arrests. Armstrong tried, however, telling CNN, ‚ÄúWe did not rush into that church. We actually went and sat down and participated in the service.‚Äù Is that what you call it?

Former CNN personality Don Lemon, who entered the church with the protesters and live-streamed their intimidating service interruption ‚Äî definitely only for the sake of journalism! (wink, wink) ‚Äî has not been arrested. Never mind, I guess, that Lemon is on video announcing his disruptive intent, noting that Armstrong began her agitating work after George Floyd‚Äôs death.

Lemon‚Äôs lawyer, Abbe Lowell of Hunter Biden infamy, says the DOJ is engaged in a ‚Äústunning and troubling effort to silence and punish a journalist.‚Äù A magistrate judge rejected charges against Lemon. That judge, by the way, is connected to the anti-ICE Democrat machine, which seems like a conflict of interest. According to Fox News‚Äôs Bill Melugin, ‚ÄúMultiple sources tell me & colleague [David Spunt] that the federal magistrate in Minnesota who refused to sign off on an arrest warrant for Don Lemon is Douglas L. Micko and that his wife works as an Assistant Attorney General in Minnesota AG Keith Ellison‚Äôs office.‚Äù

Whew, that‚Äôs a lot of news, but again, there‚Äôs a big picture.

Democrats, their Leftmedia propagandists, and their horde of left-wing agitators have a singular strategy: Discredit ICE and Trump by creating and filming confrontations with federal agents. Never mind that a lot of migrant criminals are in our nation illegally. Never mind that many of those criminals have victimized American citizens. Never mind the Rule of Law. The Left is waging a propaganda war against law enforcement.

ICE doesn‚Äôt always do everything perfectly, and there are definitely risks of overstepping. But those factors are exponentially increased when agitators provoke conflict. The ugly part is that‚Äôs exactly their strategy, even if it gets people killed.

Follow Nate Jackson on X.

news.title: Scott Bessent Unleashes On Gavin Newsom For Calling Trump ‚ÄòT-Rex‚Äô And Carrying Around Knee Pads
news.text:
Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent rebuked Democratic California Gov. Gavin Newsom again during a Friday episode of ‚ÄúThe Conversation with Dasha Burns‚Äù after harshly criticizing him on Wednesday.

Bessent likened Newsom to ‚ÄúPatrick Bateman meets Sparkle Beach Ken‚Äù on Wednesday after the governor called President Donald Trump ‚Äúa T-Rex‚Äù on Tuesday at the World Economic Forum (WEF). During the Friday Politico podcast, Bessent called Newsom ‚Äúa brontosaurus‚Äù with a tiny brain, among other insults. (RELATED: Gavin Newsom Becomes Stuttering Mess As He‚Äôs Asked If Boys Can Become Girls)

‚ÄúI think Gavin Newsom may be cracking up with some of these things he‚Äôs saying. I think he may be in over his hairdo,‚Äù the Treasury secretary said. ‚ÄúAnd being on the national stage is very different than being governor of California with no signature achievements. But to say strange things like President Trump is a Tyrannosaurus Rex ‚Äî what the hell does that mean?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou know, I could say Gavin Newsom is a brontosaurus with the brain the size of a walnut,‚Äù he continued. ‚ÄúAnd if he brought the knee pads, maybe that was for his meeting with Alex Soros. I don‚Äôt know.‚Äù

Newsom displayed knee pads that he sells on his website at the WEF on Thursday, claiming they were designed for leaders ‚Äúselling out‚Äù to the Trump administration, CNBC reported.

‚ÄúThe last round of knee pads sold out, just as our law firms are selling out,‚Äù the governor said, according to CNBC. ‚ÄúMany American universities are selling out, and yes, many corporate leaders are selling out to this administration.‚Äù

He also held up one of the red knee pads, which contained Trump‚Äôs signature, according to the outlet.

‚ÄúGovernor Newsom, who strikes me as Patrick Bateman meets Sparkle Beach Ken, may be the only Californian who knows less about economics than Kamala Harris,‚Äù Bessent said on Wednesday. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs here this week with his billionaire sugar daddy, Alex Soros, and Davos is a perfect place for a man who, when everyone else is on lockdown, when he was having people arrested for going to church.‚Äù

 Great catching up with the real star of the 2026 World Economic Forum, my friend Gavin Newsom. So glad he‚Äôs here calling out world leaders for believing appeasement works when it comes to Trump. It doesn‚Äôt. It only emboldens him to become more chaotic and destructive. World‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/s8XqrC7bqX ‚Äî Alex Soros (@AlexanderSoros) January 20, 2026 

Alex Soros is the chair of the Open Society Foundations‚Äô Board of Directors and the son of left-wing billionaire George Soros. The younger Soros posted a photo with Newsom on X on Tuesday.

news.author: Jason Cohen

news.title: Bessent Blasts Newsom Again, Mocks His T-Rex Comment and Asks If The ‚ÄòKnee Pads‚Äô Are for Alex Soros
news.text:
Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent wasn‚Äôt finished blasting California Gov. Gavin Newsom at the World Economic Forum in Davos this week. In a Friday interview, he mocked Newsom‚Äôs comparison of President Trump to a T-Rex and then asked whether the governor had brought the knee pads he previously suggested European leaders would need when dealing with Trump, this time for his meeting with Alex Soros.

"I think Gavin Newsom may be cracking with some of these things he's saying. I think he may be in over his hairdo. And being on the national stage is very different than being Governor of California with no signature achievements, but to say strange things like President Trump is the Tyrannosaurus Rex? What the hell does that mean? You know, I could say Gavin Newsom is a Brontosaurus with a brain the size of a walnut. And if you brought the knee pads, maybe that was for his meeting with Alex Soros. I don't know!"

.@SecScottBessent: "I think Gavin Newsom may be cracking up with some of these things he's saying. I think he may be in over his hairdo ... if he brought the kneepads, maybe that was for his meeting with Alex Soros, I don't know." ü§£ pic.twitter.com/i25NubkSHL‚Äî Rapid Response 47 (@RapidResponse47) January 23, 2026

This comes just days after Bessent previously blasted Newsom as a fusion of Patrick Bateman and Sparkle Beach Ken after the California Governor described the Treasury Secretary as "smug."

"Governor Newsom, who strikes me as Patrick Bateman meets Sparkle Beach Ken, may be the only Californian who knows less about economics than Kamala Harris," Bessent said on Wednesday at Davos. "He's here this week with his billionaire sugar daddy, Alex Soros, and Davos is a perfect place for a man who, when everyone else is on lockdown, when he was having people arrested for going to church. Shame on him. He is too smug, too self-absorbed, and too economically illiterate to know anything."

Gavin Newsom continues to position himself for a 2028 presidential run, and his performance in Davos suggests the effort isn‚Äôt going well. While he has attempted to cast himself as the antithesis to President Trump on the world stage, he has instead failed spectacularly.

At one point, a European reporter asked Newsom whether he had a message for Europeans concerned about President Trump‚Äôs rhetoric regarding Greenland. What followed was a Kamala Harris‚Äìstyle word salad, with Newsom telling Europeans they needed to have a backbone and ‚Äústand tall.‚Äù When reporters pressed him on what, specifically, Europeans should do, Newsom sidestepped the question, deferring instead to the preference of European leaders.

Editor's Note: President Trump is leading America into the "Golden Age" as Democrats try desperately to stop it.

Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro‚Äôs revelation that a member of Vice President Kamala Harris‚Äôs 2024 presidential campaign vetting team asked him if he had ‚Äúever been an agent of the Israeli government‚Äù marks yet another sad chapter in the Democratic Party‚Äôs ongoing betrayal of American Jews.

news.title: Jack Smith Reminds Us: Aileen Cannon Is Still Destroying America
news.text:
It‚Äôs not as if it was some deeply held secret last year that presidents can‚Äôt just lower prices, or that tariffs increase prices. Plenty of people said so and warned that Trump had no answers. But the propagandists drowned the sane voices out.

Imagine that Kamala Harris had said she was going to lower grocery prices immediately, on day one. You know what would have happened? She‚Äôd have been laughed off the campaign trail. Mocked relentlessly. And not just by the right wing. By mainstream economic commentators. By liberal pundits. By me. 

That‚Äôs because we‚Äîmainstream commentators, liberal pundits, and the millions of Americans who still do actually read stuff, weigh evidence, connect dots‚Äîwould have known it was a preposterous and desperate lie. And we‚Äôd have said so. She‚Äôd have been savaged. She and her people no doubt knew this, which is why she didn‚Äôt talk like that.
news.summary:
Most of the obvious reactions to Jack Smith‚Äôs testimony before the House Judiciary Committee on Thursday have already been delivered, and I agree with them. It‚Äôs hard to imagine what on earth Chairman Jim Jordan‚Äîand hearing his whiny, tinny, angry, lying voice awoke involuntary physiological reactions I‚Äôd spent years trying to vanquish‚Äîand the Republicans thought they were accomplishing. To any non-Kool-Aid-drinking American, they looked ridiculous. Smith was calm. The Republicans were jumping out of their skins competing to get their sound bite featured on Fox News. All they managed to do was to remind people that Donald Trump is a criminal and that in a sane world, the Senate would have convicted him on the second impeachment (the January 6 one) and barred him from holding federal office for life.

I want to focus on one matter I‚Äôd forgotten all about. I‚Äôm thinking maybe you had too. That‚Äôs the question of this second volume of Smith‚Äôs report on Trump‚Äôs crimes, which focuses not on January 6 but on Trump‚Äôs
news.author: Attorney General Merrick,Michael Tomasky

news.title: ‚ÄòJust because you‚Äôre alive doesn‚Äôt mean you are intelligent‚Äô: Viral video shows teacher berating student for defending ICE agent who shot Renee Good
news.text:
In the tumultuous wake of Renee Good‚Äôs death, a video from Minnesota‚Äôs Becker High School is going viral on social media.

The footage captures social studies teacher Dr. Heather Abrahamson heatedly arguing with a student about the fatal shooting of Good ‚Äî the 37-year-old anti-ICE protester who struck ICE agent Jonathan Ross with her vehicle while deliberately impeding an immigration enforcement operation in Minneapolis on January 7.

On a recent episode of ‚ÄúSara Gonzales Unfiltered,‚Äù Sara played the footage and discussed the radical politicization of our teachers‚Äô unions and the leftist indoctrination of our youth with Teacher Freedom Alliance CEO Ryan Walters.

In the clip, Abrahamson insists that Officer Ross should have de-escalated the situation. 

‚ÄúYour job as a police officer is to de-escalate,‚Äù she spat, gesturing dramatically at the dissenting student, who fired back, ‚ÄúHe had a split second.‚Äù

‚ÄúWatch the video! He was not in danger,‚Äù Abrahamson retorted, ignoring the fact that footage from the incident captures Ross being propelled backward as Good‚Äôs vehicle makes contact with him and numerous reports that Ross suffered internal bleeding following the incident.

‚ÄúJust because you‚Äôre yelling doesn‚Äôt mean you‚Äôre winning an argument,‚Äù the student said, refusing to bend.

‚ÄúJust because you‚Äôre alive doesn‚Äôt mean you are intelligent,‚Äù Abrahamson clapped back.

The recording of this chaotic encounter, distributed by Libs of TikTok, has amassed nearly 4 million views on X and sparked intense debate over political indoctrination in classrooms.

‚ÄúThis is a very pervasive issue,‚Äù Sara says, displaying the following memo recently distributed by the National Education Association arguing for increased anti-ICE activism.

This kind of left-wing activism poisoning America‚Äôs classrooms, Walters says, is ‚Äúa coordinated effort from the teachers‚Äô unions.‚Äù

‚Äú‚ÄòTell your students that the police are the enemy, that ICE is the enemy‚Äô ‚Äî and this is exactly what they're pushing into our schools,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not a one-off. It‚Äôs not, well, you know, here‚Äôs some crazy left-wing socialist teacher. No, this is the teachers‚Äô unions utilizing their foot soldiers to ... undermine this country through the classrooms.‚Äù

Sara brings up a recent Fox News article that exposed the NEA ‚Äî the largest teachers‚Äô union in the United States and the largest labor union overall in the country ‚Äî for funneling millions in union funds during the 2024 fiscal year to various far-left and social justice-oriented groups and ballot initiatives.

‚ÄúIn a lot of these places, the teachers don‚Äôt have a choice. They have to join the union. They have to pay the fees,‚Äù Sara says. ‚ÄúI mean, it‚Äôs adding insult to injury that you‚Äôre essentially stealing from someone because they want to have the occupation as a teacher and then you‚Äôre using it to fund [left-wing] causes.‚Äù

Walters says that it‚Äôs paramount that we stop them.

‚ÄúWe have to defund them. Every teacher, you should opt out. Go to optouttoday.com. Get out of the union. Quit paying union fees to destroy this country. ... And every state should be passing legislation to rail back on the union‚Äôs power. There shouldn‚Äôt be teachers‚Äô unions,‚Äù he says.

‚ÄúWhat you have in the teachers‚Äô union is this huge apparatus of power. They have a ton of money. They have a ton of resources. They are embedded in the Democrat Party. They are one of their biggest funders,‚Äù he continues.

Walters warns that if we fail to defeat teachers‚Äô unions, the consequences are potentially massive: ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre going to gear up all this before the congressional elections, just like they did for Kamala Harris when over $400 million went from the teachers‚Äô union to her presidential campaign. Same thing‚Äôs going to happen in this election cycle.‚Äù

But the money is just the weapon ‚Äî the real war is in our classrooms.

Teachers‚Äô unions, Walters says, have been instrumental in brainwashing younger generations into becoming America-hating, die-hard Democrats.

‚ÄúWe didn‚Äôt just wake up one day ... [with] millions of kids that sit here and think we‚Äôre an evil, racist country. They think cops are bad guys. That didn‚Äôt just happen. It happened because of a coordinated attack,‚Äù he says.

The viral video of Dr. Abrahamson insulting a student‚Äôs intelligence because he refused to condemn an ICE agent he believes acted in self-defense is merely one thread in a vast tapestry of proof.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got to turn this around 180 degrees in the other direction and go back to a patriotic education, love of country, love of American values. We‚Äôve got to get back to that,‚Äù Walters urges.

To hear more of the conversation and see the viral video, watch the episode above.

Want more from Sara Gonzales?

To enjoy more of Sara's no-holds-barred takes on news and culture, subscribe to BlazeTV ‚Äî the largest multi-platform network of voices who love America, defend the Constitution, and live the American dream.

news.title: Trump‚Äôs post-per-minute Truth Social spree at midnight hits on TikTok, political targets and Melania trailer
news.text:
President Donald Trump indulged in a midnight Truth Social spree shortly after returning from Davos, Switzerland, where he railed against familiar political foes and promoted the first lady‚Äôs upcoming documentary.

Trumpshared a flurry of more than 70 posts and reposts from midnight to 1 a.m. ET having arrived back in Washington, D.C. after traveling some 4,200 miles from the World Economic Forum.

Truth Social is often the first port of call for the president to share major policy news that impacts Americans, although only 3 percent use the platform, according to a Pew Research Center study.

In between launching attacks at longtime targets, including Minnesota congresswoman Ilhan Omar, former President Joe Biden, California Governor Gavin Newsom and former presidential Democratic opponent Kamala Harris, Trump took the time to promote the trailer for MELANIA, the $40 million Amazon documentary centered on his wife. 

In the early hours of Friday, the president repeated false claims about 2020 election fraud, and also took credit for ‚Äúsaving TikTok‚Äù after a deal was reached Thursday to allow the Chinese-owned social media giant to operate in the U.S.

‚ÄúI only hope that long into the future I will be remembered by those who use and love TikTok,‚Äù the president wrote. 

Other posts shared by the president were clips from pro-Trump news channels including Fox, NewsMax and Breitbart. He also shared an article from news site The Hill titled, The Trump Obsession.

After a few hours of online silence, the president was posting again at 7 a.m. ET. 

House Speaker Mike Johnson told The Independent that the president, 79, ‚Äúsleeps about three hours a night‚Äù when questioned about Trump‚Äôs slurring of words and appearing to mix up Greenland with Iceland in Davos. 

‚ÄúIs this a serious question? This president sleeps about three hours a night,‚Äù Johnson said. ‚ÄúHe outwears everybody in this building by a factor of two or three. He's gotten more done in the first year of his presidency than anybody in history. I cannot even believe you asked me that question.‚Äù

While delivering a speech about his Gaza ‚Äúboard of peace‚Äù at the conference, Trump was spotted with a large bruise on his left hand.

‚ÄúI clipped it on the table. So I put a little‚Äîwhat do they call it‚Äîcream on it,‚Äù he told reporters. ‚ÄúI clipped it. I would say take aspirin if you like your heart, but don‚Äôt take aspirin if you don‚Äôt want to have a little bruising.‚Äù
news.summary: Trump was rapidly posting between midnight and 1 a.m. after traveling some 4,200 miles from Davos, Switzerland
news.author: Rhian Lubin

Grok ceated three million sexualised deepfakes in 11 days, including 23,000 of apparent children

The recent rollout of an editing feature on Grok, developed by Elon Musk‚Äôs startup and integrated into X, allowed users to make extreme edits to images of real people.

2.32pm, 23 Jan 2026

Share options

ELON MUSK‚ÄôS AI chatbot Grok generated an estimated three million sexualized images of women and children in a matter of days, researchers say, revealing the scale of the explicit content that sparked a global outcry.

The figure includes 23,000 images that appear to include children.

The recent rollout of an editing feature on Grok, developed by Musk‚Äôs startup xAI and integrated into X, allowed users to alter online images of real people with simple text prompts such as ‚Äúput her in a bikini‚Äù or ‚Äúremove her clothes.‚Äù

A flood of lewd deepfakes exploded online, prompting several countries to ban Grok and drawing outrage from regulators and victims.

‚ÄúThe AI tool Grok is estimated to have generated approximately three million sexualized images, including 23,000 that appear to depict children, after the launch of a new image editing feature powered by the tool on X,‚Äù said the Center for Countering Digital Hate (CCDH), a nonprofit watchdog that researches the harmful effects of online disinformation.

CCDH‚Äôs report estimated that Grok generated this volume of photorealistic images over an 11-day period ‚Äì an average rate of 190 per minute.

Advertisement

The report did not say how many images were created without the consent of the people pictured.

It said public figures identified in Grok‚Äôs sexualized images included American actress Selena Gomez, singers Taylor Swift and Nicki Minaj as well as politicians such as Swedish Deputy Prime Minister Ebba Busch and former US vice president Kamala Harris.

‚ÄúThe data is clear: Elon Musk‚Äôs Grok is a factory for the production of sexual abuse material,‚Äù Imran Ahmed, the chief executive of CCDH.

‚ÄúBy deploying AI without safeguards, Musk enabled the creation of an estimated 23,000 sexualized images of children in two weeks, and millions more images of adult women.‚Äù

There was no immediate comment about the findings from X. When reached by AFP by email, xAI replied with a terse automated response: ‚ÄúLegacy Media Lies.‚Äù

Last week, following the global outrage, X announced that it would ‚Äúgeoblock the ability‚Äù of all Grok and X users to create images of people in ‚Äúbikinis, underwear, and similar attire‚Äù in jurisdictions where such actions are illegal.

It was not immediately clear where the tool would be restricted.

The announcement came after California‚Äôs attorney general launched an investigation into xAI over the sexually explicit material and several countries opened their own probes.

Related Reads

T√°naiste says Cabinet proposals ready in weeks to deal with AI non-consensual sexual images 

Professor Mary Aiken: Grok is a warning shot, not a one-off scandal

X refuses to come before Oireachtas Media Committee to answer questions on Grok scandal

In Ireland, X has refused to come before the Oireachtas Media Committee next week to answer questions.

Grok‚Äôs digital undressing spree comes amid growing concerns among tech campaigners over proliferating AI nudification apps.

Last week, the Philippines became the third country to ban Grok, following Southeast Asian neighbors Malaysia and Indonesia, while Britain and France said they would maintain pressure on the company.

On Wednesday, the Philippines‚Äôs Cybercrime Investigation and Coordinating Center said it was ending the short-lived ban after xAI agreed to modify the tool for the local market and eliminate its ability to create ‚Äúpornographic content.‚Äù

Today, Dublin City Council said it will stop posting on X in light of the scandal.

CEO Richard Shakespeare told representatives that it will review how they use social media ‚Äúto ensure that the platforms we use, and our use of them, align with and support the City Council‚Äôs values‚Äù.
